- [x] Get Playwright working


Keep getting stuck on `npx playwright test`:

```
Please install @playwright/test package to use Playwright Test.
  npm install -D @playwright/test
```

But I just installed it!

```
      - run: npx playwright install --with-deps
      - run: npx playwright test "e2e.spec.js"
```

Runs fine locally, too. But for some reason.

- [x] rust auth client logic

Possible authorization failures to test:

- [x] Resource endpoint
- [x] Search endpoint
- [x] Changing rights
- [ ] Websockets (subscribing to unauthorized things)
- [x] TPF (currently disabled unless public mode)

title: Change commit serialization no pkcs8 #98
body: match serialization #98

title: Remove String Atom, only use RichAtom
body:
The first store was string based, and the Resource model was String based too. This, however, led to incorrect datatypes. I made the store stricter by storing Enum Values. This PR cleans up the last remnants of this older data model.

But I'm not 100% sure that the string based atoms have no value / no reason to exist. That's why this isn't merged yet.

title: Huge refactor, add  collection sorting, fix internal data consistency
body:
- Get rid of `resource_string` representation
- In-memory `Store` uses `Resources`
- Only validated data enters the store
- Had to move some data from `default_store.ad3` to the `populate` function to fix a recursive bug when initalizing the store (long story)
- Added Collection sorting #63 
- Made the `validate` method pretty much obsolete. Only valid data enters the store.
- More things

title: Remove store ref from resource, add table view
Auto renew let's encrypt certs on start #47
body: When atomic-server is in HTTPS mode, it will check if the certificates are 4 weeks or older. If true, it will request new ones.

title: Client-server write interaction, post commits from CLI
Get rid of &mut #15
body:
So I've managed to get rid of the `&mut` thing #15 using Arcs and Mutexes. Everything works fine.

But I'm still wondering if this is the way to go - I'm a bit worried about performance overhead. Haven't done any benchmarks.

title: SSL HTTPS Cert init automation #8
body: Fixes #8
